name: gfc_2020_v18_gain
title: Forest cover gain
description: Forest gain during the period 2000-2012, defined as the inverse of loss, or a non-forest to forest change entirely within the study period. Raw data is encoded as either 1 (gain) or 0 (no gain). Values provided through GeoQuery are the sum of pixels within each boundary that experienced a gain.

extract_types_info.categorical: number of pixels of forest loss which occured in each year
extract_types_info.count: total count of pixels per unit of analysis

extras.citation: Hansen, M. C., P. V. Potapov, R. Moore, M. Hancher, S. A. Turubanova, A. Tyukavina, D. Thau, S. V. Stehman, S. J. Goetz, T. R. Loveland, A. Kommareddy, A. Egorov, L. Chini, C. O. Justice, and J. R. G. Townshend. 2013. “High-Resolution Global Maps of 21st-Century Forest Cover Change.” Science 342 (15 November): 850–53.
